alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 10:20AM PST until further notice by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Rain, heavy at times, in the Olympics through tonight will keep the Skokomish River above flood stage through at least Wednesday.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. WAC045-280230- /O.CON.KSEW.FL.W.0074.000000T0000Z-000000T0000Z/ /SRPW1.2.ER.221224T2018Z.221227T0015Z.000000T0000Z.NR/ 1020 AM PST Tue Dec 27 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause moderate flooding, with deep and quick flood waters inundating some residential areas, many roads, and much of the farm land in the Skokomish Valley. Inundated roads include the Skokomish Valley road, Bourgault Road West, Purdy Cutoff Road, and Highway 106. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM PST Tuesday was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested at 17.9 feet and is expected to gradually diminish through the afternoon and evening. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
